intro: Amorphophallus luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon mountain arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its large,戟-shaped (rake-shaped) leaves and an underground tuberous structure. The plant produces a spadix inflorescence, which is surrounded by a spathe, typical of many arum species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. The tuber is edible and has been used in traditional cuisine by local communities.
